title: 30-Minute Sausage Tortellini Soup

description: This hearty and comforting sausage tortellini soup is a family favorite that comes together in just 30 minutes. Packed with flavor and wholesome ingredients, it's perfect for busy weeknights when you crave something warm and satisfying.
instructions: In a large pot, cook the Italian sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until the onion is translucent.
Pour in the chicken broth and diced tomatoes, bringing the mixture to a boil.
Stir in the tortellini and cook according to package instructions until tender.
Add the fresh spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot with grated Parmesan cheese on top.
tips: For a richer flavor, try using homemade broth and adding a pinch of red pepper flakes for a little heat.

structured_content.content: This 30-Minute Sausage Tortellini Soup is the perfect dish for those chilly evenings when you want something warm and filling. The combination of savory sausage, tender tortellini, and fresh spinach creates a delightful balance of flavors and textures that will have your family asking for seconds.

structured_content.content: This soup reminds me of family dinners growing up, where we would gather around the table, sharing stories and laughter. It's a dish that brings everyone together, and the aroma fills the house with warmth and comfort.

• Main ingredient: Italian sausage adds a rich flavor; choose a mild or spicy version based on your preference.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garlic and onion are essential for building a flavorful base.
  • Supporting ingredients: Fresh spinach adds color and nutrition, while cheese tortellini provides a satisfying bite.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by removing the casings from the sausage and chopping the onion and garlic.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cook the sausage until browned, then add onion and garlic, followed by broth and tomatoes. Bring to a boil, add tortellini, and finish with spinach.
Finishing Touches:
Serve hot, topped with freshly grated Parmesan cheese for added flavor.

upload.context: Capturing the cooking process of the soup simmering in the pot.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the sausage until fully browned for the best flavor.
  • Avoid overcooking the tortellini to keep them tender.
  • Look for wilted spinach as a sign that it's ready to serve.
  • This soup can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days and reheated on the stove.

structured_content.content: Sharing this soup with my family is always a joy, especially on cold nights when we can gather around and enjoy a warm bowl together. It's a dish that feels like a hug in a bowl.
Consider adding a splash of cream for a richer soup, or toss in some red pepper flakes for a spicy kick. Fresh herbs like basil or parsley can also elevate the flavor profile.
This soup pairs wonderfully with crusty bread or a simple green salad. For a complete meal, serve it alongside a glass of red wine.
For a lighter version, substitute turkey sausage and use whole wheat tortellini. You can also make it vegetarian by omitting the sausage and adding more vegetables like zucchini or bell peppers.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Brown the sausage thoroughly for maximum flavor.
  • Prep your ingredients ahead of time for a quick cooking experience.
  • Keep an eye on the tortellini to prevent mushiness.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to make this comforting soup; it's easy, delicious, and sure to become a staple in your home. Enjoy the process and the delightful aromas that fill your kitchen!
